sub_title: Marketing & Admissions Manager @ SILC Academy | Crafting Success Stories | Growing Professionally | Love Data & AI | Excited by Developments in the Marketing and Tech World
summary:
I'm the Marketing & Admissions Manager at SILC Academy, known for experiential learning programmes in Switzerland and France. I hold a Master's in International Business Communication and International Marketing, graduated with honours in 2021, and have a keen interest in leadership, online/offline marketing, and SEA, especially Google Ads and Meta.

In my role, I oversee a diverse marketing function covering online/offline channels, website development, sales of camps, and agent relations, among other tasks. I also help shape SILC's brand strategy. Every summer, I immerse myself in the vibrant world of our camps, where I oversee large cohorts of students and staff.

This experience fuels my unyielding enthusiasm for marketing, leadership, SEO, SEA, and design. I thrive in dynamic, multicultural teams, and my professional journey has traversed various countries and sectors, encompassing high-end hospitality, academia, education, and events.

My insatiable appetite for new knowledge, eagerness to explore fresh opportunities, and readiness to tackle emerging challenges make me a forward-looking professional who is always striving to enhance my skill set. I’m equally passionate about forging connections with individuals from diverse backgrounds, particularly in unique and transformative settings.

Let’s connect and explore how we can collaborate to drive innovation and growth within the world of marketing.

#marketing #sales #data #ads

awards.title: Holland Scholarship Beneficiary
awards.description: Holland Scholarship is financed by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science and Dutch research universities and universities of applied sciences. The scholarship is meant for registered students of Stenden UAS the Netherlands who want to study abroad by taking part in the exchange programme at a NON-EU destination or in the GRAND TOUR programme at one of the Stenden Univerisity's campuses in South Africa, Qatar, Thailand or Indonesia.

profile_positions.description:
A diverse and a generalist marketing role where I am responsible for delegating:
- Google platforms - Google Ads, Google Analytics, and Google Search Console.
- Development and sales of THE SILC Merchandise (www.the-silc.com).
- Website building and editing through WordPress & Squarespace (incl. minor developers’ tasks such as working with CSS, HTML & reCaptcha application and installation).
- Partnerships with external parties such as agents and international schools (College Champittet).
- Copywriting for social media, websites, newsletters and such.
- Newsletters through Mailchimp.
- Social Media - Facebook & Instagram (including Meta Advertising Platform).
- Creative briefs for photography (e.g., Merchandise content).
- Day-to-day working with Adobe Creative Cloud - InDesign & Photoshop.

Also, exciting sales and admissions responsibilities:
- Sales of Summer & Winter camps. 
- Main point of contact for families whose children join the camp(s).
- Sales of Merchandise and additional complementary services for the camps
- Organisation of the summer camps (2 in France and 2 in Switzerland): Logistics & Management.
- Building a sense of community with parents & students to deliver the true SILC Family feeling.

Summer Camps that I am involved in:
1. SILC Creative & Entrepreneurial Summer Camp in Côte d'Azur
2. Sea & Island Adventure in Corsica
3. Champittet Summer Leadership Course in Lausanne, Switzerland
4. Gstaad Summer Leadership Camp in Château-d'Oex, Switzerland

Winter Camp that I am involved in:
1. SILC Winter Leadership Camp in Château-d'Oex, Switzerland
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Admissions Manager

profile_positions.description: This was a maternity replacement position. It was a full-time position that I got before graduating from my master's. I had the opportunity to work partially at the Central Marketing & Communications department of Radboud Univeristy as International Events Marketer. Additionally, I partially worked at the Nijmegen School of Management as an International Marketing & Recruitment Officer at the Internationalisation, Communication and external Relations (ICR).
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Communications Officer

profile_positions.description: This was a student assistant job in the online marketing team of the Radboud University Marketing & Communications department. I was responsible for the newly established Instagram account @StudyAtRadboud. Additionally, I delegated a team of social media contributors for Europe, LATAM and Asia (around 30 people). Besides the varied tasks, I helped with content creation, Open Master's Days, giving presentations and working with agents from Turkey and Bulgaria.
profile_positions.title: Online Marketing Coordinator

profile_positions.description: This was a student assistant position for dr. B. C. Hendriks and dr. W. F. J. van Meurs with their research on accents in Dutch. Together with another student, we were assisting the researchers with the development of their pre-test and main experiment instruments, questionnaire, data collection, data analysis and writing the report. The paper was named 'Attitudes to regional and standard accents in commercial and non-commercial contexts'.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
A part-time student job which comprised of creating YouTube videos for Radboud University.
Example vlogs can be found below. This was genuinely the most creative marketing jobs of all! Combined with helping prospective students, it was an amazing experience.
profile_positions.title: International Student Vlogger

profile_positions.description: This was a part-time job next to my studies. Due to Covid-19 and other personal circumstances, I did not get the chance to work at the hotel as often as of September 2020.
profile_positions.title: Server

profile_positions.description: This was the 10-month internship I had to complete to be able to graduate from Stenden Hotel Management School with my BA. I was working closely with the Marketing manager and assisting her with collateral creation on InDesign, Photoshop and Premier. Additionally, I worked with influencers to promote the hotel. Needless to say, social media and the content planning was a daily and weekly routine for me. Also, I assisted the marketing manager and other responsible professionals in collaborations with Magnum, Iamsterdam, GASSAN Diamonds, de Bijenkorf, Cartier, and a global marketing campaign for Hilton Worldwide, among others.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
* Stenden representative at an educational fair in Turkey, Bulgaria, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia.
* International Open Day organization for November 2016, February, April & June 2017
* Workshop 'Connecting with prospective students' organization for Ambassadors 
*Organizing individual and group visits by international prospective students
profile_positions.title: Marketing Coordinator - Head Ambassador

profile_positions.description: Before the beginning of each academic year, an extensive one-week event takes place at the Stenden Hotel Management School (SHMS). During that time, the new SHMS students get to meet their fellow colleagues. The host leaders work in guiding Host groups as well as assisting the Host Coordinators in organizing and conducting events, trainings, and administration during and after the Study Start Week (orientation week) for the first year students.  Each group consists of 10-15 new students headed by 2 Hosts (current Stenden students). As a Host leader, I supervised around 10 Host groups. This means that I was responsible for approximately 150 individuals. My tasks were to make sure that everything went according to the planning and when students had issues that were beyond the understanding of their Hosts, they were able to address me.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Sales - Host leader

profile_positions.description: I had the honour to be working for the beach restaurant " 't Badhuys ", part of the WestCord Hotels on the alluring island of Vlieland, part of the Frisian province. It is one of the two beach restaurants with a permanent status on the beach. The restaurant was also awarded to be "The Best Beach Restaurant in the Netherlands for 2017".  During my time at this astonishing workplace, I got to learn about the finest hospitality. I learnt how important it was to appreciate the presence of our guests. I obtained skills that cannot be taught at school such as how to manage inquiries that might be obscure. Also, I learnt how to work efficiently together with my team even when it is busy at the workplace to make sure that everything goes smoothly. When it comes to what I enjoyed the most working in such a lovely restaurant was the fact that I had the freedom to talk to our guests, to make sure that they were having a peaceful lunch/ dinner - exactly what they came for: to relax and be happy.
profile_positions.title: Server

company.name: Български младежки Червен кръст / Bulgarian Red Cross Youth

volunteer_experiences.description: I was trained in different fields during my voluntary work at Red Cross - foster care, drug addictions, basic knowledge of RC/ RC, prevention of HIV/ AIDS, fundraising. During my voluntary work in the organization, I was also given the chance to go to the Annual Friendship Camp in Langenlois Austria. At this event, together with many other people from all around the globe, we were working on different topics such as Geneva conventions, refugees, cultural differences, wars, disasters, restoring family links. Moreover, the knowledge from all the training was being applied through various campaigns and knowledge transfer sessions at different schools in the region.

The aim of my participation in this organization was to broaden my knowledge about the prevention of drugs. I participated in two pieces of training - in the village of Dazhdovnica and in the hotel ‘Kardzhali’ related to the topic. Furthermore, I was given the opportunity to carry out on my own various information lectures in my high school.
